intro: Helicteres ovata var. fructus-regis, commonly known as the royal fruit tree, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. These fruits are edible and have a mildly sweet, tangy flavor, making them popular in local cuisines. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses.
